metadata.title: CVE-2019-13721 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Use after free in PDFium in Google Chrome prior to 78.0.3904.87 allowed aremote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTMLpage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13721` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 78.0.3904.97-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 78.0.3904.97-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 78.0.3904.97-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 78.0.3904.97-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 78.0.3904.97-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '78.0.3904.97-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
